caption.center: STATE OF MISSOURI, RESPONDENT, v. LUCKY BILL MINER, DEFENDANT/APPELLANT.

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS, HON. MICHAEL P. DAVID.Page 192
opinion.attorneys:
Gary E. Brotherton, Asst. Public Defender, Columbia, for appellant.
Jermiah W. (Jay) Nixon, Atty. Gen., Catherine Chatman, Asst. Atty. Gen., Jefferson City, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before: Mary K. Hoff, P.J., Gary M. Gaertner, J., and Mary Rhodes Russell, J.
opinion.opinion_text:
[1] Defendant appeals from the judgment entered after a bench trial finding him guilty of one count of murder in the second degree in violation of section 565.021.1(2) RSMo 1994 on which he was sentenced to fifteen years imprisonment.
[2] No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion reciting the detailed facts and restating the principles of law. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
[3] We affirm the judgment pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
